description: TRIDENT attack/weakness/control graph data for Open Security Architecture

deprecation.reason: Superseded by TRIDENT mitigation path (Control -> Mitigation -> Technique) which uses MITRE first-party data. CTID is a third-party interpretive mapping with 99.5% overlap with the mitigation path but lower authority.
deprecation.retained_for: backtesting, quality assurance, coverage validation against TRIDENT mitigation path

technique_control_mappings.notes: CTID maps 11 NIST families. Controls in other families (AT, AU, IR, MA, PE, PL, PM, PS, PT) have no ATT&CK mappings in this dataset. LEGACY: retained for validation only — the TRIDENT mitigation path (Mitigation -COUNTERS-> Technique, CIS Safeguard -ALIGNS_TO-> Mitigation, Control -IMPLEMENTED_BY-> CIS Safeguard) provides equivalent coverage using MITRE first-party data.

mitigations.notes: 44 ATT&CK mitigations (M-series) with technique COUNTERS relationships. Cross-referenced to SP800-53 controls via shared technique coverage (PRESCRIBES edges). M1055 'Do Not Mitigate' correctly has no control links.

detection_strategies.source: MITRE ATT&CK STIX Data (v18 detection overhaul)
detection_strategies.notes: ATT&CK v18 replaced Data Sources with Detection Strategies (DET-series). Each strategy maps to one technique via DETECTS relationship.

cis_safeguard_index.notes: Reverse index of CIS v8 safeguard -> SP800-53 controls from existing OSA compliance mappings. Provides the IMPLEMENTED_BY edges in the TRIDENT model.

weakness_catalog.notes: CWE weakness classes mapped to ATT&CK techniques via CAPEC attack patterns. 135 CWEs map to 132 techniques in our catalog through 485 EXPLOITS edges. CAPEC IDs normalized from bare numbers to T-prefixed ATT&CK format.

threat_actors.notes: 163 active ATT&CK threat groups (G-series intrusion-sets) with USES relationships to techniques. 9 actors excluded (revoked/deprecated or no technique overlap with our 469-technique catalog). Actors carry aliases but not country attribution (deferred).

process_capability_catalog.author: Chris Lethaby (Vinylwasp)
process_capability_catalog.notes: 30 process capability classes across 19 NIST 800-53 families. Each capability mapped to SP800-53 controls, CIS Safeguards, and ATT&CK Mitigations. Provides CLASSIFIED_BY edges connecting process implementations to canonical capability identifiers.

technology_capability_catalog.author: Chris Lethaby (Vinylwasp)
technology_capability_catalog.notes: 28 technology capability classes across 9 categories with 86 individual capabilities built on MITRE D3FEND. Each class mapped to SP800-53 controls, CIS Safeguards, and ATT&CK Mitigations. Provides PROVIDES_CAPABILITY edges connecting technology implementations to capability profiles.

adversary_capability_model.author: Chris Lethaby (Vinylwasp)
adversary_capability_model.notes: 5 adversary capability tiers (T1-T5) classifying all 469 ATT&CK techniques by minimum adversary sophistication required. Tiers are cumulative — higher tiers include all lower tier tradecraft. Uses STIX 2.1 vocabularies for actor attributes and NIST SP 800-30 capability/intent/targeting model. Technique assignments based on tool availability, skill requirement, detection difficulty, operational complexity, and prerequisite access.

human_factors_model.author: Chris Lethaby (Vinylwasp)
human_factors_model.notes: 24 cognitive vulnerability classes across 6 categories. Social engineering classes (AU/UR/TR/CU/HB) map to ATT&CK techniques via EXPLOITS_HUMAN edges with rationale. Insider disposition classes (IN) have no technique edges — they are risk factors mitigated by SP800-53 controls. Cialdini principle mapping on 17 of 24 classes; remaining 7 map to cognitive biases outside Cialdini framework.

data_classification_catalog.author: Chris Lethaby (Vinylwasp)
data_classification_catalog.notes: 14 data type classes across 8 categories with 4 classification tiers (DC-0 through DC-3). Each data type carries regulatory drivers, impact domains, and protection requirements grouped by data state (at-rest, in-transit, in-use, lifecycle, logging). Provides REQUIRES_PROTECTION edges (DataType -> Control) and PROTECTS_DATA edges (Control -> DataType) for threat-led pattern derivation.

cloud_service_catalog.author: Chris Lethaby (Vinylwasp)
cloud_service_catalog.notes: 22 cloud service entries across 7 providers and 11 service model categories. Each service carries shared responsibility splits — provider controls (inherited, customer does not implement) and customer controls (must implement, patterns derive from these). Replaces CPE for cloud services where traditional versioning and CVE models do not apply. Provides PROVIDER_IMPLEMENTS and CUSTOMER_IMPLEMENTS edges for threat-led pattern derivation with shared responsibility awareness.

protocol_catalog.author: Chris Lethaby (Vinylwasp)
protocol_catalog.notes: 37 protocol entries across 11 categories covering network transport, name resolution, authentication, file sharing, web/API, remote access, email/messaging, database, infrastructure, cloud/container, and industrial protocols. Each protocol carries ATT&CK technique references (TARGETS_PROTOCOL edges), secure alternative references (UPGRADES_TO edges), and SP800-53 control references. 3 ICS protocols (Modbus, OPC UA, BACnet) included with empty technique arrays — their techniques are ICS ATT&CK domain, not in the Enterprise catalog. SECURES_PROTOCOL edges (Control -> Protocol) deferred to separate design pass.

trident_paths.direct_shortcut: Technique <-mitigates- Control (CTID, in control attack_techniques[] — LEGACY, retained for validation only)
trident_paths.data_classification_path: DataType -REQUIRES_PROTECTION-> Control / Control -PROTECTS_DATA-> DataType (TDCE regulatory-driven control derivation)
trident_paths.cloud_service_path: CloudService -PROVIDER_IMPLEMENTS-> Control / CloudService -CUSTOMER_IMPLEMENTS-> Control (TCSE shared responsibility derivation)
trident_paths.protocol_path: Technique -TARGETS_PROTOCOL-> Protocol (TPE protocol-specific attack surface derivation)

files.technique-catalog.json: 469 ATT&CK techniques with mitigations[], detection_strategies[], weaknesses[], actors[], minTier back-references
files.mitigation-catalog.json: 44 ATT&CK mitigations with techniques[], controls[], cis_safeguards[]
files.detection-catalog.json: 691 ATT&CK v18 detection strategies with techniques[]
files.cis-safeguard-index.json: 171 CIS v8 safeguards with controls[] reverse index
files.weakness-catalog.json: 135 CWE weakness classes with techniques[] via CAPEC bridge
files.actor-catalog.json: 163 ATT&CK threat groups with techniques[], aliases
files.process-capability-catalog.json: 30 TPCE process capabilities with controlRefs[], cisSafeguards[], attackMitigations[]
files.technology-capability-catalog.json: 28 TTCE technology classes with 86 capabilities, controlRefs[], cisSafeguards[], attackMitigations[], D3FEND alignment
files.adversary-tier-catalog.json: 5 TACM adversary capability tiers with STIX/NIST attributes and technique tier distribution
files.human-factors-catalog.json: 24 THFM cognitive vulnerability classes across 6 categories with Cialdini mappings and SP800-53 control refs
files.data-classification-catalog.json: 14 TDCE data type classes across 8 categories with regulatory drivers, impact domains, and protection requirements
files.cloud-service-catalog.json: 22 TCSE cloud service entries across 7 providers with shared responsibility splits and customer/provider control mappings
files.protocol-catalog.json: 37 TPE protocol entries across 11 categories with technique references, secure alternatives, and SP800-53 control mappings
files.graph-edges.json: 19,773 explicit TRIDENT graph edges across 18 relationship types
files.metadata.json: This file — provenance, version info, graph summary
